results.title: Frog went a-courtin'
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: The story of Mr. Frog and Miss Mousie, made from the illustrations of Feodor Rojankovsky, and sung by John Langstaff. The story is told twice, the second time the words are superimposed on the screen facilitating audience (children) participation.

results.title: Frog dreaming
results.creator_credit: Brian Trenchard-Smith, Barbi Taylor and Middle Reef Productions
results.brief_description: Something’s alive at the bottom of an uncharted pond, and the 10 year old adventurer Cody (Henry Thomas of ET) is determined to find it. The action of this children’s movie (involving Aboriginal magic) is set in a remote town in southern Australia. The real adventure is Trenchard-Smith’s rediscovery of boyhood, with all its inventiveness, innocence and independent fearless strength.

results.title: Friluft: 'The call of the open-air'
results.creator_credit: Jorgen Roos, Dansk Kulturfilm and Minerva Films
results.brief_description: A lighthearted historical cross-section of the open air movement. This film covers outdoor sports/recreation activities throughout Danish history, commenting that Danes first started the scout movement in 1909 and the Youth Hostel movement in 1930 for example. Increasing urbanisation in the cities resulted in society becoming more inward, preferring to stay indoors rather than being sporty as their ancestors once were. As female clothing became freer, along with loosening social mores, people began to go outdoors once more. Chiefly based on original historical material-paintings, engravings, photographs and old films, contrasting with the final live action sequence of present-day. Danish language with English sub-titles. Music by Bent Fabricius-Bjerre and written by Tork Haxthausen.

results.title: Friendship's Death
results.brief_description: In September 1970, a British war correspondent is distracted from his coverage of the conflict between Palestinians and Jordanians when he rescues a young lady from a PLO patrol. Named Friendship, she claims to be an extra terrestrial robot sent to Earth on a peace mission and accidentally diverted from her original destination, The Massachusetts Institute of Technology. Is she insane, a spy, or telling the truth? Wollen’s film comes across as a two-set Dr Who for adults, complete with political, philosophical and personal problems. Rated: M

results.title: Friends and neighbors = Friends and neighbours
results.creator_credit: Edmund Penney, Jack Wipper, Lori Productions and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: Investigates learning to live together, how to treat friends and neighbours, and shows how it is often easy to take advantage of the weak and gullible and to ignore social responsibility. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Friends and foes
results.creator_credit: Martin Green, ABC-TV (Australia) and Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
There are major biotic factors which affect plant growth including the impact of pests and diseases and the competition with other plants for light and resources. Highlighted are some of the techniques developed to control these problems and the beneficial relationships which exist between plants and living organisms. A contemporary approach known as Integrated Pest Management looks at various methods used to control pests and disease while minimising environmental impact.

results.title: Friends and Enemies
results.brief_description: This is a provocative film about one of the most vicious and protracted labour disputes in Australian history. In February 1985, over one thousand electrical workers went on strike against the introduction of contractors into the South East Queensland Electricity Board. Rated: PG
